intro: Haplopappus australis, commonly known as the Australian smooth pappus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to dry conditions. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in a flat, disc-like structure, and it produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Haplopappus australis is often found in sandy soils and is well-suited to coastal and inland regions with low rainfall.
